An integral transformation \\( T \\) defined by \\( T[z](t) = \\int_0^t e^{-s} z(s) ds \\) is applied to analyze the system's behavior.

If the transformation \\( T \\) is applied to the system's initial output \\( z(0) \\), and then the system evolves according to its LTI dynamics without further intervention, will the output at time \\( T \\), \\( z(T) \\) be influenced by the initial function application of \\( T \\)?
Explanation: Applying the transformation \\( T \\) at the initial stage modifies the initial conditions of the system, hence impacting the entire evolution path due to the convolution nature of the integral transform. As the LTI system's behavior is affected by initial conditions, the initial application of \\( T \\) influences the output at any later time, including at time \\( T \\).
